title: Eric Louis 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: Although the producer is based in Sancerre, this wine has an almost southern warmth to it. Its orange blossom aromas, rich tropical fruit flavors and balanced acidity make it ripe and ready to drink now.

title: Feudo Principi di Butera 2015 Syrah (Sicilia)
description: This dense and ripe Syrah offers mature black-skinned fruit, allspice and smoke tones. Its core of ripe black currant fruit is accented with a confectionary note of vanilla and punctuated by rounded tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Florian Roblin 2015 Champ Gibault Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: The wine is crisp, tangy and with plenty of grapefruit and lemon fruitiness. Its crispness and nervy texture are bright and refreshing. With fine acidity at the end, this is ready now.

title: Foris 2015 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)
description: Barrel fermentation has rounded and softened this wine without it losing focus. Crisp apple and pear fruit carries it, with a whiff of white asparagus.

title: Magnum Vinhos 2016 Flor de Maio Mayflower Branco White (Alentejano)
description: The red poppy flowers across the Alentejo in the spring. This wine, with its lightly perfumed and soft texture, has green plum and spice flavors, gently lifted by balancing acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Manastira 2016 Riverside Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)
description: This straw-colored Sauvignon Blanc from Bulgaria's Thracian Plains has fresh cut grass and lemon blossom aromas. On the palate, expect lemongrass, fresh fig, mango and dried herb flavors.

title: Michel Vattan 2015  Sancerre
description: This is a light fruity style of wine, full of red cherries. It has a spicy edge along with a supple base of tannins. With its fruit and acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Muddy Arch 2015 Roussanne (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is all about savory, nutty flavors rather than overtly fruity ones, and it has a smooth mouth-filling texture. It's very broad but well balanced and easy to sip.

title: Jean-Pierre Bailly 2015  Pouilly-Fumé
description: The wine's ripe fruit is balanced by a crisp texture. Apple and citrus are well to the fore, bringing out the acidity. That contrasts with the steely texture that will allow this young wine to age for another year. Drink from 2018.

title: Global Wines 2015 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)
description: This ripe and textured wine has tannins as well as bold red fruits. The wood aging shows in the spice and vanilla flavors that give the wine its firm richness. Drink now.

title: Isabelle et Pierre Clément 2015 Châtenoy Rosé (Menetou-Salon)
description: Menetou-Salon uses Pinot Noir for its rosés, like nearby Sancerre. The wine is in a fresh, crisp style, emphasizing acidity and red currant. It is light in feel and bright with red-fruit that lingers.

title: James Charles 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: This wine evokes aromas of spring—fresh peach, lemon and pomelo mix with white flowers and a fresh green stem note. The palate is velour-soft in feel, yet there is a crispness from a citrus note that offers balance. The finish is mid-length and offers layers of flavors.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Colheita Red (Beira Interior)
description: This simple, open and fruity wine has gentle tannins. It is all about ripe berries and acidity. Made to be drunk young for its fruitiness, it is ready now.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2016 Castello d'Alba Branco White (Douro)
description: From vines grown in the upper Douro Superior, this is crisp while also having ripe apple and apricot fruitiness. It is a lively wine, tangy with orange zest and a touch of spice. Drink now.

title: Ransom 2013 Selection Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This late release sourced from several vineyards dating back to the 1970s and 1980s is thin on the palate, with tart plum, herb, orange peel and of pineapple hints. Low alcohol reflects the cool vintage.

title: Simple Machine 2013 Leverage White (Rogue Valley)
description: Made in the style of a southern Rhône blend (half Viognier and one quarter each Marsanne and Roussanne), this is lightly lemony, with a bit more fat in the middle. None of the three grapes overpowers the others, but the flavors feel a bit generic. Though fermented in stainless steel, it's gold in color and shows some hints of toast.

title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 Ardósia Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.

title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Porrais Red (Douro)
description: The quinta for this wine is on the plateau north of the Douro river. It has produced a red-fruit wine, rich with soft tannins and juicy fruitiness. The wood aging is already well integrated into this bold, ripe wine. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2015 Vintage  (Port)
description: This wine is light in body but heavily perfumed. Clean fruit shows on the palate, with an addition of geranium aromas.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2016 Rosé (Douro)
description: This full-bodied wine conveys Douro warmth. A light touch of tannin gives it shape. Pepper and red-berry fruits complete a generous wine that will be best with food. Drink now.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Philippe Viallet 2016 Gamay Rosé (Vin de Savoie)
description: From a number of small parcels of vines, this wine is intensely fruity—full of ripe red berry flavors. It has a tight, zesty character, while also having a richer side. Drink now.

title: Pixels 2015 Glera Sparkling (Thracian Valley)
description: This sparkling Glera has apple blossom and lemon zest aromas. The bubbles are nicely distributed amongst pear and mandarin orange flavors. It ends in a crisp finish.

title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: Consistently the top showing wine from the Le Val range, this is ripe and rounded, with a creamy texture and a toasty, spicy touch from light wood aging. Drink now.

title: Secret Spot Wines 2016 Vale da Poupa Rosé (Douro)
description: This ripe, full-bodied rosé is made from 100% rich, perfumed Touriga Nacional. Good balance between ripe strawberry fruits and the crisp acidity make it both fruity and warm. Drink now.

title: Sutcliffe 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colorado)
description: Bright raspberry and cherry cola take the lead while vanilla and cedar follow on the palate of this light-bodied Cabernet. Cherry and vanilla are joined by soft fading tannins on the finish.

title: Ten Sisters 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine features a heavy dose of baking spices and vanilla layered atop notions of earth and red cherries. It's a little dry and woody, but cinnamon and clove notes add charm.

title: Nicolas Millet 2016 Champ Secret  (Sancerre)
description: The wine is soft and round. It has a light herbal edge to the otherwise smooth peach and citrus flavors. The aftertaste brings in an attractive mineral texture. Drink this crisp clean wine now.

title: Wine Spots 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick extracted wine that's simple in execution. It's a full-bodied showcase of blackberry, black cherry, leather and cedar.

title: Gian Piero Marrone 2014  Barbaresco
description: This wine's menthol, crushed herb, red berry and violet aromas emerge in the glass. The palate evokes raw red cherry, pomegranate and white pepper and is structured by firm acidity and bracing tannins, feeling tight and austere.

title: Gruet 2011 Sauvage Sparkling (America)
description: Made from 100% Chardonnay, this shows lemon, apple and nectarine on the nose with hints of croisant. Spritely bubbles quickly fade, leaving honeydew, green apple, nectarine and a hint of pastry. The finish is fresh with lemon juice and tart apple.
